thread.title: Comment on Kentucky Opens Up as Underdogs by Moto
thread.title_full: Comment on Kentucky Opens Up as Underdogs by Moto

author: Moto
title: Comment on Kentucky Opens Up as Underdogs by Moto
text:
Posted in Main | 3 Responses 
According to Vegas Insider and the Wynn, Kentucky is not expected to win this coming weekend against Mississippi State. The Wildcats open up as 11.5 point underdogs to the Bulldogs, coming off a win against Louisiana Tech. 
If we’re being honest, this is a steal. If you live or are visiting the city in the desert, take Kentucky. Article written by Bobby Reagan One time representative of UK at SEC 3v3 basketball championships. Northern Yankee living the Kentucky dream. Follow me @uklefty22 3 responses to “Kentucky Opens Up as Underdogs” The Rest of the story October 18, 2015 at 10:25 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Cats should be at least that much or more . The run and pass D really suffered against a poor Auburn offense. Also Towles has a bad habit of making very poor decisions under pressure. Cannot see a win here but hope for the best. Six wins is most this team can achieve this year and that won`t be easy. Dude October 19, 2015 at 1:08 am | Permalink 
Just stop watching them, dude. It’s obvious you can’t handle it. Go watch baseball. Moto October 19, 2015 at 2:54 am | Permalink | Reply 
A stat I thought was worth noting since our next game is against Mississippi St.; Pass attempts/interception ratio. Towles, Kentucky 200 pass attempts, 7 interceptions Prescott, Mississippi St 225 pass attempts 0 interceptions Post Comment - New and Improved (not really, it just works now)
